intro: Melandrium astrachanicum, commonly known as the Astrachan poppy, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
